comments.content:
I take it that this is a recent movie and not something from the hand lettered era. No distinctive letters included in the sample so there are various fonts that would be an adequate substitute, all somewhat similar to a narrow Helvetica or Smart Sans. I expect that someone will dig out an exact match for you shortly.  
Don

The film is the soon-to-be-released 'Starred Up' [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zE4ziBfu0JA](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829160528/https:/www.youtube.com/watch?v=zE4ziBfu0JA "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zE4ziBfu0JA")  
Yep, a Helvetica Ultra or Extra Compressed would appear a good fit  
Thanks!

Ryuk - that's a perfect match - typical that it should be a v expensive Hoefler & Co font

Great work for recognising it anyway

Rgds
